Defendant who challenged the traffic stop performed by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino and testified during cross-examination
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: White Malibu sedan rented by RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. at the Laredo International Airport, registered to Hertz Rental Car Company, containing five or six illegal aliens
Defendant who was placed in holding cells, potentially constituting a de facto arrest, driver of the black Dodge pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: Black Dodge pickup truck driven by IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., impounded due to lack of proof of insurance and potential theft concerns
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented aliens: Individuals being transported in vehicles, displaying suspicious behavior such as wearing caps and appearing stiff, found in RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu sedan
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle and IGN: Vehicles mentioned in the conversation between United States Border Patrol Agent Hugo Benavides and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent who conducted the initial stop and testified about his observations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: Law enforcement agency involved in the incident, with agents arriving at the scene after Officer Reymundo Reyes's interaction with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reymundo Reyes: Freer Police Department officer who wrote a citation for IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and decided to impound the black Dodge pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security who interviewed IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Department of Homeland Sec: Law enforcement agency involved in the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle stop: Traffic stop of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu sedan by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle stop: Traffic stop on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 where United States Border Patrol Agent Hugo Benavides arrested IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle stop an: Traffic stops of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu sedan and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s black Dodge pickup truck on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRI: Defendants who took an indirect route to avoid the Hebbronville Checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.J. Scott Hacker: United States Magistrate Judge who signed the Report and Recommendation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Hugo B: Agent who interacted with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. en route to the Border Patrol station and testified about his uncertainty regarding arrest
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alberto Ramirez: Director of Transportation, Planning and Development for the Texas Department of Transportation, Laredo Division, who testified about the accuracy of traffic flow data
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation: Agency responsible for preparing district traffic maps
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hertz Rental Car Company: Rental car company with locations throughout the United States, including the Laredo International Airport
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo International Airport: Location where RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu sedan was rented from Hertz Rental Car Company
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.SANTIAGO HINOJOSA: Manager with the Hertz Rental Car Company at the Laredo International Airport, who testified about the company's rental policies
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Ignaci: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint: Location where Marco Montemayor arrived to investigate an attempted alien smuggling event
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge: Primary United States Border Patrol agent who conducted the initial stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Border Patrol Station Parking Lot: Location where IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. was held in a holding cell
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reymundo Reyes's questions: Questions asked by Officer Reymundo Reyes to determine the purpose of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s trip and verify vehicle ownership
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Police Department: Police department where Officer Reymundo Reyes is employed
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.an arrest without a warrant: Proper only if probable cause supports it
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.probable cause for a warrantless arrest: Exists when the totality of facts and circumstances within a police officer's knowledge at the moment of arrest are sufficient for a reasonable person to conclude that the suspect had committed or was committing an offense
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: Road taken by the defendants, which is not the most direct route to their destination
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol agents: Law enforcement agency involved in the incident, with agents arriving at the scene after Officer Reymundo Reyes's interaction with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.camper: tool of the smuggling trade, potentially used to transport aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.camper shell: equipment that could be used to hide illegal aliens in a vehicle
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Bruni, Texas: Destination location at the southern terminus of Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hebbronville Checkpoint: Checkpoint on U.S. Highway 359 that the defendants attempted to avoid
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 359: More direct route to Bruni, Texas, which the defendants did not take
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 59: Highway taken by the defendants before turning onto Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ranchitos Las Lomas: Possible origin of the defendants' journey if they did not start in Laredo, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2895: Alternative route to Bruni, Texas, which would be more direct than Farm-to-Market Road 2050
